parameters: [Ask Harry about what Scottie told him]
[Ask Harry about what Scottie told him]
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiLook, \.\.sir,\.\. I don't know what stories you've been told,\| but-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWell, \.\.all I know is, \.\."Harry"\. has a real ring to it, \.\.y'know?
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiImagine introducing yourself as \.\."MODEL 14_01", \.\.as if you're nothing but a \|\{MACHINE.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI mean, \.\.the \."Scott Schtick"\. works great\..\..\..\.\. 'til you meet another Phoney using the same name.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiLook,\.\. we all have weird memories and fantasies...
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI hope that answered your question.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiScottie told you that name, \|didn't she?
\fiWhy, is there something odd about the name?
\fiWhy, is there something odd about the name?
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWell, \.\.it \{IS\.\} an uncommon name, \.\.yes,\.\. but that's not the source of my bewilderment.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...it's more that you know who Abel \.\.\.\{WAS.

\|
And most company personnel split off into two groups after that.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiPeople who didn't know Abel, \.\.and therefore \.\.\{couldn't\.\} talk about him-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAnd people who knew him, \.\.and as a result, \.\.would've rathered talk about anyone \.\.\.\{BUT\.\} Abel.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiMost people didn't know his alive-name, \.\.since y'know-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAnyone who knew it was too afraid to say it.
\fiScottie mentioned that he was a bastard of a boss.
\fiScottie mentioned that he was a bastard of a boss.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiBack in the beginning,\.\. the company was made up of six managers, \.\.\.one of whom was the owner.

\|
I'm not up to talking about him.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiYou'll have to find another Phone who's up to \|\{THAT\.\} job.

\.\.\.
He isn't with us anymore, \.\.and hasn't been for a very long time.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI was one of the remaining five managers.

\|
A picture paints a thousand words, \.\.\.or so they say-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiObviously, \.\.that's me on the very right.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiThe guy on the very left was named Joe.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe was someone I grew very close to.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe got scrapped years ago,\.\. after the metal around his spinal cord rusted...
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...I don't know if you've read \.\.\c[10]'The Joy of Creation'\c[0]\.\. by Dr. Henry Miller, \.\.but-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiIn his final weeks, \.\.Joe was burdened with a pain that,\.\. to this day,\.\. I can't even \.\.\{conceive\.\} of experiencing...

\|
"Scratch the surface of a cynic, \|and you'll find a disappointed idealist."
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiIn case you're curious as to why Phone Guys now have swear words hard-wired out of their coding-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiYeaaah, \.\.Joe is the sole reason why.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiGuy could've taught your average sailor a new swear or two.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...He never liked Joe much at all.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiY'know, \.\.most Generation One Phone Guys can't remember \|\{ANYTHING\.\} about their past lives...
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI was the first Generation One model,\.\. and they wiped my memory completely.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiBut,\.\. he never gave up on me.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI had no idea who he was, \.\.but he had years of memories worth of me.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiFrom the fresh-faced young veteran with a dodgy leg, \|looking for any sort of work I could get my hands on-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiTo the day I got promoted-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiTo the night we all stayed up, \.\.\.drinking in the office on an opening night for location 14,\| telling stories about our various stunts during our shifts-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...to the day when Joe came from the factory,\| as a Phone Guy,\.\. and I wouldn't let go when I saw how genuinely hurt he looked-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiThen,\.\. Terrence was the guy standing next to Joe.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe was the last manager to be promoted before me, \|in fact, \.\.we worked the floor in location 6 together for a month or two-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiTerrence was always an optimist, \|and somehow,\.\. he never lost that as a Phone Guy.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe was always happy to be at work,\.\. to see sunshine again, \.\.\.to speak to me,\.\. and know that I was \.\."alive"\. and \."well-"
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiOne day,\.\. I asked him why he was so damn happy every day, \|and asked him why he didn't seem nearly as down in the dumps as the rest of us.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe might as well have said:

\|
"I can't frown, \.\.because I don't have a face."
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiMany years ago, \.\.the elevator broke down at the factory,\| while we were inside.

\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiEver the instigator, \.\.Terrence removed the emergency panel, \|and decided to climb up to the control room on the top floor, \|so he could enable the elevator's manual override.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiSure enough, \.\.the elevator rebooted and whirred to life.
\..\..\..while Terrence was still on top of it.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiIt rose to the top floor before Terrence had the time to get back inside-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWhat we found of Terrence on top of the elevator \.\.and on the roof of the elevator shaft-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI don't know if we could've brought him back, \.\.but frankly,  \.\.\{I\.\} wouldn't have wanted to be brought back if I were him.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiThe guy standing next to me, \.\.to my left, \.\.was Everett.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiIf you think I'm stiff,\.\. you should've seen him-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiGuy wore a suit \.\.\{LONG\.\} before he became a phoney, \.\.from what the others told me.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI remember the owner had a cook-out that summer,\| and invited us.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiEverett turned up dead-last,\.\. and sure enough, \.\.he was decked out in formalwear.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe stood him at the gate.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi"What do you call that?", \.\.Joe asked.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiEverett and Joe clearly had different opinions on what \|"casual"\. meant.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe cried out: \.\."You're wearing a full suit to a barbeque!
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiTo which Everett replied:\.\.\. "Nonsense,\.\. I'm wearing my waistcoat!"
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...I'd never seen Joe bellylaugh before that-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...Perhaps a little too gentle for his job.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiLong story short, \.\.he tried to clean a dead nightguard's remains up,\.\. but-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWell,\.\. if you've seen any nature documentaries,\.\. you should know that there's a food chain-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...and that the guys at the bottom of the food chain should wait 'til the predators clear off\|\.\. before touching what they've been eating.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiEverett's failure was bad enough, \.\.\.so picture the amount of stitching he needed just to keep his innards in his torso-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWell,\.\. Freddy tore each and every one of those stitches out.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...and gravity took care of the rest of the job.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAbel wasn't the second Phone Guy.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWe all suffered various accidents, \.\.all springlock failures, \.\.I believe-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...of course, \.\.once Abel realized what springlock suits did to people when they malfunctioned...
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe decided that he'd simply never wear one.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe gave Joe that job, \.\.once he became the company boss.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...and after Joe's accident, \.\.Terrence got the job.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...and after Terrence's accident, \.\.that became Everett, \.\.which Joe wasn't too thrilled about.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI don't really know what happened next.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI have a few pieces of broken memories.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe never admitted that it was him,\| but if it was anyone,\.\. it would've been Joe.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI remember nothing much after that.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAbel had me taken to the factory.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe accompanied me on the way, \.\.but he wouldn't tell me anything from when I left Freddy's \|\.\.to after the process had been completed.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiEach of us were a work in progress.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe was the model \.\.that taught Abel to hardwire swears \.\.\{OUT\.\} of the Phone Guy AI.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiTerrence was the model \.\.that taught Abel to strip some of the optimism out of the AI.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiEverett was the model \.\.that taught Abel to strip just a smidgen of the stiffness out of the AI.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAbel used their personalities as test modules for the AI.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiBut,\.\. of course,\.\. Abel hated that the others kept contacting their families-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiFelt they were less focused on their work that way.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiDecided to strip the old memories out,\.\. and replace them with what the Company \|\{wanted\.\} me to remember.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAll of the managers were furious.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI know I may seem like an old fart,\.\. but-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWell, I was the last of five.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...I don't think anyone took it as hard as Joe.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAll of the conversations we had-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiMy old family,\.\. my old life-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAnd while I may not have remembered-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWe all had a feeling deep down, \.\.what Joe wanted.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiThe company had broken me,\.\. and he wanted justice.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe never told me what happened next,\| but one night, \.\.after we'd had a few drinks, \.\.Terrence and Everett spilled the beans.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiBasically,\.\. Everett,\.\. Terrence \.\.and Joe\. ganged up on Abel when he got to the factory one day.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiDragged him into the production room,\.\. and closed the door behind them.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiTo the room that contained\..\..\.. \.\.\c[10]the Machine.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe told him that all of the other company veterans had become Phone Guys...
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...and that it was time for him to pay his dues, \|since they all knew he was going to avoid it for the rest of his life.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiTold him that it was his turn \.\.to get \.\.\{HIS\.\} skull shoved into a rotary phone.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe brandished a phone, \.\.said he'd picked it himself,\.\. and told Abel that it'd be his new head.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiOf course, \.\.Abel didn't take it sitting down.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi"Oh,\. no,\.\. my skull,\.\. my skull won't fit inside that thing,\.\. it's much too thin-"
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiJoe interrupted with:\.\. "Don't you worry,\.\. Abel."
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI don't feel bad for Abel.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi'You live by the sword, \.\.you die by the sword', \.\.or so they say-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI always felt bad for Joe, \.\.though.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiY'know, \.\.I imagine a lot of people would presume that I feel cheated.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI don't \{\.\.HAVE\.\} many memories of my past life, \.\.sir.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI don't doubt a word of what he said,\.\.\. but-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiWell,\.\. "Harry"\. was the product of his experiences-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAnd that was all stripped away.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiBy and large, \.\.I have no clue what I'm missing.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAnd without my memories, \.\.I really don't know for sure what this company has taken away from me.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiIt was bad enough for Joe,\.\. knowing what the company had taken from \|\{HIM-
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fi...and then seeing the company take everything away from me.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiHe had the burden of awareness.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI don't remember my past life,\.\. but Joe sure did.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiAnd every time he thought about the memories we shared, \|and the life I lost out on,\.\. all he saw was red.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiSorry, \.\.I've been rambling for a long time.
\n<\c[10]Phone Guy\c[0]><Wordwrap>\fiI'll see you on the flipside, \.\.sir.
